locations.name: Auckland
locations.description: New Zealand's largest city, serving as the starting point and gateway for experiences like visiting Waiheke Island.

locations.name: Rotorua
locations.description: Known for its geothermal activity, unique spa experiences, and significant Maori cultural sites and performances.

locations.name: Queenstown
locations.description: An alpine resort town set by Lake Wakatipu, famous for adventure sports, scenic beauty, and fine dining.

locations.name: Sydney
locations.description: Australia's iconic harbour city, featuring the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, and vibrant urban life.

locations.name: Whitsunday Islands
locations.description: An archipelago off the coast of Queensland, renowned for white-sand beaches, turquoise waters, and access to the Great Barrier Reef.

locations.name: Uluru
locations.description: Located in Australia's Red Centre, this area is home to the sacred Uluru monolith and Kata Tjuta formations, central to Aboriginal culture.
